I listed his use of a textbook high because he relies almost entirely on his online notes (which are free and very descriptive) so you don't have to buy an expensive book with a bunch of garbage in it.
He's a great instructor and while a bit eccentric, he's knowledgeable, helpful, and cares about teaching.
Highly recommended!
Great instructor.
He covers everything you need to succeed in his class (even stuff you should already know).
He keeps lectures interesting and encourages student participation without being condescending.
He uses notes sets that are very concise and his test questions come straight from them so no surprises and makes challenging material easier
He has an online note set with answers and such and normally if you just do that you should be able to do well on the test.
However, going to class has it's benefits because he will go over something that isn't explained too well or doesn't have an answer in the note set book of his.
All his tests has cheat sheets.
(test number + 1) Also, no HW.
Alexander used a free "book" which you could pretty much study and not have to go to class.
But, he always had interesting stories and kept class pretty interesting.
Tests were not very hard, very few homeworks, and attendance was not required.
Just a great professor all around.
You can tell he really enjoys teaching, and knows the material like the back of his hand.
He always has great side stories relevant to the topic to tell; I actually used the other side of my notebook to make notes of just his stories.
He also has his own condensed noteset for the textbook, for free.
